name: opelxp2
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, c3))

stmt.origin: simprbi(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c0, c2))
stmt.pretty: simprbi(< c0, c1 > ∈(c2 × c3), c1 ∈ c3, c0 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, c3))
-| wb(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, c3))
-| wb(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3)))

body.origin: |- wb(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c3)))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, c3))

comment: The second member of an ordered pair of classes in a Cartesian product belongs to second Cartesian product argument. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.)
